definition[0]: soft light bits of thread that have come from wool, cotton, or other materials
example[0]: He was picking bits of fluff off his trousers.
definition[1]: soft light hair or feathers, especially on a young bird or animal
example[2]: The chicks were just balls of yellow fluff.
definition[2]: news, music, writing, work etc that is not serious or important
example[3]: a magazine full of pop and fashion fluff
definition[3]: to make a mistake or do something badly
example[4]: He fluffed his shot and missed the goal.
example[5]: She fluffed her lines in the first scene.
definition[4]: to make something soft become larger by shaking it
example[6]: She fluffed up the pillows for me.
definition[5]: if a bird fluffs its feathers, it raises them and makes itself look bigger
